rComments: The best prof at UofT by far. I have never enjoyed a class so much in my time here. She tells you exactly what she wants for assignments and makes lecture really interesting. I am not in religion but managed to really enjoy the course. 10/10 recommend. I wish I could take more courses with her.

Prof. Bugg is the best professor at UofT. So caring, helpful, and actually really hilarious. She creates really awesome projects so doing the work for the course is actually exciting and more immersive than just writing a research paper. Wish she taught more upper year courses. LOVE!!
Dr Bugg is such an amazing professor. Will definitely take her other courses in the future.
A very caring prof that wants the best for all her students.

Professor Bugg is such a great professor, she's super engaging in lecture and makes the atmosphere relaxed and fun. She's always there to help students and she is so caring and friendly. She gives all the questions that will be on the final exam beforehand and let's you bring in notes to the exam which was a lifesaver!!

Bugg made first year enjoyable. She truly cares for her students's mental wellbeing. She makes an effort every class and through emails to make sure we understand concepts and to ensure we are okay with some of the material. Bugg is extremely kind and caring. I would take her courses again.

Great first year class and teacher. Introduces you to the coursework of uni - there is a lot of reading but worth it for such an interesting class. Makes it fun with videos, music, food, etc - would highly recommend.
teacherRatingTags: ['Graded by few things', 'Get ready to read', 'Caring']

rComments: Honestly, Laura Beth made first year bearable. I found her class motivated me to actually work in school and the material in this class was incredibly interesting. She is engaging and is really funny. Her lectures are interesting and use a range of media to get you involved. 10/10 would recommend

Bugg is a great lecturer & keeps you engaged throughout the 2 hours. Short readings are assigned so she expects you to do them and engage in class discussion. The only bad part of this course is that the TA was a VERY tough marker and didn't provide sufficient feedback to help you improve. Overall great course.
